column1: Kihei (Hawaiian: Kīhei) is a census-designated place (CDP) in Maui County

column2: −156.457228).According to the United States Census Bureau
column3: the CDP has a total area of 11.7 square miles (30.2 km2)
column4: of which 9.3 square miles (24.0 km2) is land and 2.4 square miles (6.2 km2)
column6: is water. It is considered to be the South Side of Maui
column7: located on the leeward side of Haleakala.  The climate is arid
column8: receiving no more than 10 inches (250 mm) of rain per year.

column3: -156.51417 There is no public bus service that stops here; however
column4: it is located near Ma 'alaea Harbor Village
column5: where there is a public transportation stop. It's primarily used for hikers
column6: bicyclists and ride sharers looking for a meeting place that is centrally located between Kihei
column7: Lahaina and Wailuku. There's no charge to park; the lot is unattended.

column1: The Kihei Aquatic Center hosts swim meets and other aquatic activities.The Valley Isle Road Runners host a number of running events throughout the year that include the Maui Marathon Events
column2: Iao Valley 10k and 5k and the Na Holo Wahine 5k and 1 Mile walk for women. The running clubs also hosts a couple free to members runs that non-members are invited to join for a small fee.

column1: Several research facilities are located in Kihei
column2: including the main offices for the Hawaiian Islands Humpback Whale National Marine Sanctuary
column3: seed operations by DEKALB Genetics Corporation and Monsanto Company
column4: and the Maui Research and Technology Park
column5: which is home to the Maui High Performance Computing Center (MHPCC)
column6: and the  Pacific Disaster Center and is overseen by the Air Force Maui Optical and Supercomputing observatory (AMOS).
